title: Get "501 invalid domain name" on auth attempt via smtp
content: I'm trying to connect to smtp server with Thunderbird, but get "Invalid domain name". Thunderbird is installed on Win7 inside VM. SMTP-server is server of my company, not some of the well-knowns like google. Since VM "situated" outside the company's internal net, I have to also use domain name to get access. For connection i'm using port 587, user name in format "domain_name\mail_login", "connection security" is "starttls" and auth method is "normal password". Internet on VM works fine and i can access to the desired mail and sending mails via browser without any problems.
